Carolyn Brown is one of my favorite Oklahoma authors. Really, she is one of my favorite authors, but she writes about Oklahoma in a way that makes me proud to live here. Most of Carolyn Brown's books are romances published by Avalon Press which I believe is out of business. Hidden Secrets is published by Montlake Romance and not really a romance though it does contain romance. Hidden Secrets is the story of four generations of women who on the spur of the moment agree to spend the summer in Oklahoma to manage a farm which is left to Hannah Brewer by a distant cousin she has never mentioned before. The women leave their lavish lifestyles in West Virginia for various reasons with hidden secrets. Eighty year old Hannah wants to relive the summer she turned sixteen on her previous visit to Oklahoma where she met Norma Andrews. Hannah's daughter, sixty year old Karen Tarleton, is in the middle of a messy divorce and battle over a winery that she owns with her husband. Karen's forty year old daughter, Sue DeHaven, is a widowed school teacher needing something to fill her summer break. Sue's twenty year old daughter, Kim DeHaven, needs the summer to tell her perfect family that she is pregnant and the father is getting married to someone else. None of them imagine that they will stay in Oklahoma beyond the summer.
Great story...Very easy reading. Wonderful story with so much love and happiness. I highly recommend if you enjoy a nice love story, which in this case had a bit of a surprise ending.

4 generations of women all move from the city and luxury to a farm, which the great grandmother, Hannah, inherited from an old friend. I love the interactions between the ladies and other friends they meet when they move to the farm. There are a couple of romances brewing, which is a must for anything I read!
First timer with this author and I really enjoyed it. I might keep an eye out for her other books

A beautiful and quirky storySuch a beautiful story about a family of women growing closer and finding themselves. This is one of those feel-good stories that make you question your own baggage and insecurities.

Another book that I absolutely like. It was fun yet a bit intriguing. The first few chapters I had a bit of issues to get thru to them, because for some reason they made the book feel predictable, but as I kept reading this book kept throwing curb balls that made every prediction fade away and left me wanting to keep reading and not put it down.I had a hard time at the beginning with Nana Hannah, she was too bossy, and annoying somehow, but as the story developes I finally understood her and she grew big on me. What can I say I love Nana Hannah as I love the rest of the ladies in the Brewer family and friends. As secrets were being revealed life started to change for them, they went from feeling guilty to feeling free Thanks to Norma, who after her death she left everything set for the Brewer girls to have some sort of life change from the way they were living. Thia womens were loving, stubborn and hard headed, but most of all they were independent and decided to make a life of their own and not just settle for what they thought was going to be correct from others people point of view.

Just perfect!These four generations of ladies really deserved happy endings. Norma was their little PUSH away from the bad in their lives so they could really live happily. Great characters. I love reading sweet stories that really have meaningful messages that the reader can take away from it. Great read. Must read!!

If you want an easy read, this book is for you! I read this as an audiobook and it was fantastic! Four generations of women reveal their innermost secrets and grow with each other along the way! I would highly recommend it!

Awesome readI love this novel. Four generations of women telling their story together. I really had to make myself put my Kindle down to sleep because I wanted to keep reading. I will be looking for other novels by Carolyn Brown.
Great BookI really enjoyed this book. I really enjoyed the way it began. The way it suddenly has twists and the ending was great.
Happy ever after Sweet family story, with some revealed hidden secrets. Good family humor, a story of love between mothers and daughters and grandmothers.
very good read. good family values and friendshipvery good read. good family values and , would recommend to others to read. loved the plot twists as well
Hidden SecretsWhat a good read this book was. I couldn't put it down until I knew the secrets. Good characters that you can relate to.
A sweet storyI so enjoyed reading this sweet story. These four generations of strong women have stories to tell. Sometimes life does not turn out as planned, but even better!

Brewer women and their xscretsHannah is the matriarch of the Brewer women, Karen is her daughter, Sue is her granddaughter, and Kim is her great granddaughter.When Hannah gets notice that her cousin in Meet, Oklahoma has died and lefts her the farm. Hannah calls all the women together to go with her, it seems very strange. None of them knew there was a cousin in Oklahoma.High class ladies from Virginia moving to a dirt farm in Oklahoma is the start of this lovely tale of family getting to know each other and loving each other.True dynamics of Hannah running the show and everyone doi g as she says. That find a life where they are truly happy and don't want to leave.CAROLYN BROWN has written a lovely, heartfelt story for all to read.

This book was NOT what I was expecting. Based on the description I thought there would be some angst and a lot to do with the pregnancy. But..... yeah that's not what this was. EVERY problem felt like my 8 and 10 year olds wrote it. It was THE WORST THING EVER!!!!!! Only in the very next sentence it was like "oh, nope it's fine - actually better than fine!". Ugh.... It was SO frustrating. The jump between time periods was odd too. There were very subtle clues or no clues that we had jumped a week or so in time until a few sentences into the chapter. I didn't get it, didn't find it all that compelling and was glad to be done with it.

I read Carolyn Brown's The Wedding Pearls book and it was decent. I am not sure why but this book felt like I was re-reading that book - the plot was almost identical. Relatives die, inherit stuff, get re-aquainted with each other and some people fall in love and some die. I am pretty sure it is the same plot with just new character names, a new town and slightly different variances. It was difficult to finish this one, but I did. I was listening to it on audio while cleaning. I had to make myself finish it. Had I not read the other book first I would give it a higher rating. I am a little leery to read any more books by this author because of this.

I suspect many aspects of this story are predictable and/or generic, but I had a blast listening to this in audiobook form. Perhaps it's because I'm not as well read as other people.This is my second Carolyn Brown book, the first being The Barefoot Summer. It has many of the same qualities with a bit of southern flavor thrown in. The tale is very heart-warming and sweet, telling of four women discovering a new life away from their old town and learning each other's flaws. The conflict is not quite as intense as in other stories, but then that's not really the point.These two books have made me a Carolyn Brown fan. I'll be checking out several other books of her from here on out.

I listened to this book and at first it took me a minute to get into the story. I'm from the south. I've been surrounded by southern drawls my entire life. The narrator's drawl, sort of distracted me from the story at the beginning. I finally got used to it and remembered who was who. The Brewer women have always put the ones that came before them up on a pedestal. Their summer adventure allowed the women to get to know each other and share things they otherwise didn't know. They also learned things about themselves. It was good for them to get out of West Virginia. It was a sweet story.

Secrets to love and keep you involved...As I began to listen to the audio version of this book I was delighted to Find that the story begins in Morgantown West Virginia where I went to To the University, And then lived after I was married and had my 2nd child there. It was a delight getting to know the characters and find out all about their secrets. It will leave you wanting to know more and eager to read another book by Caroline Brown.

Actually "read" the audio version on an Alaskan cruise. My first audio book, so it took some getting used to - having one woman narrating all the parts (including the men). But the plot took over and I forgot the weirdness as I got into the story. Listened as often as I could get away on the cruise, all the way on the long drive home and was 15 minutes away from the end when we pulled into the driveway. Now I miss these strong Brewster women and the sexy farmers who loved them.

This is another favorite by Carolyn Brown. Hidden Secrets deals with relationships, family, memories both good and bad and perceptions. How you see yourself and how you think others see you. It is the story of four generations of women in the Brewster family and their path to love and understanding. I enjoyed every minute of this book and was sad for it to end.

Absolutely fell in loveI love this author. Haven't enjoyed a story this much in a long time. The story is great, love the people. This is my first book by Carolyn Brown, and I intend to read all the others. If you haven't read her books before go for it you will not be sorry,enjoy!!!!

I felt as I read this book that it was a modern day fairy tale. Make believe farming and every thing turned out to be just wonderful. It is not true to life. Make Believe sums up the whole thingIt would be nice to live in a wonderland where every thing turns out to be just the best life ever. It is totally let's pretend.

Refreshing Family TaleCircumstances and the death of an old friend, lead to an inheritance and move to a small town farm in Oklahoma. As four generations of women love to together and share their hidden secrets, they build a tighter bond with one another and find real love and acceptance in their relationships. Well written girls novel!

Can't help but love them all........It never fails to beat my expectations when I read anything written by C Brown, she takes people, and turns them into your next door neighbor, or that person you left behind when you still had something to say, love this one and all of the other stories, I promise to keep on reading, so I hope she doesn't stop the writing......

This is the second book of Carolyn's I have read; first one being "The Ladie's Room". The stories are sweet and wholesome with a good story line. I look forward to reading her other books!The story captures your interest and I find it hard to put it down. I would recommend for young and old alike!

A mother, a daughter, a granddaughter and great granddaughter all up root themselves from there there lives to live in Oklahoma on a farm. These women are all from Morgantown city girls not country girls. Plus they are estranged, and all have problems in which they have to come to terms with and in the end makes them stronger and closer. This story was endearing.

Another heartwarming storyLove the generational stories. Strong women made stronger when they open up and tell their secrets. I just wanted Karen to find someone too. And the epilogue was such a good wrap up. I loved that both Kim and Sue fought to save the farm from fire and didn't just run away to safety. And did not apologize for their actions. Great story!

description: Kim Brewster’s ill-fated marriage was annulled so quickly that she thought she could keep the whole thing a secret…until she found out she was pregnant. But before her confession can blow a hole in the seemingly perfect lives of the Brewster women, her great-grandmother, Hannah, drops a bomb of her own. She’s selling her hotel and moving to a farm in Oklahoma—and all the Brewsters are coming with her. Kim is sure her grandmother, Karen, and mother, Sue, won’t go along with the plan, but Hannah can be very convincing. Soon the women are working the farm, selling their wares from a roadside stand, and finally feeling like a family.And as the Brewster women’s lives take shape in ways they never expected, Kim may have found another shot at love. Luke thought he’d washed his hands of women, but when he stops by the vegetable stand and meets Kim, he’s instantly smitten. To find love, though, they’ll both have to dig past their hidden secrets.
title: Hidden Secrets
